input: Imagine a self-contained, hypothetical world with only the following conditions, and without any unmentioned factors or causal relationships: Liking spicy food has a direct effect on the forest. The smoker has a direct effect on the forest. For people who do not like spicy food, the probability of the forest on fire is 43%. For people who like spicy food, the probability of the forest on fire is 81%. Will liking spicy food decrease the chance of the forest on fire?
